title: (x) Bj�rk Greatest Hits typeface - custom font {Lars}
content:
I not sure if this is an actual Typeface.   
I have tried using whatthefont.com and identifont to no avail.   
I think this typeface has been made with a illustrator or freehand pen tool to achieve a handwriting/ pentool line style.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224251im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38871.jpg)
author: jazjack

comments.content: B?�dere was a whole thread about fonts like this, but something happened to the archive. The best I know of is [Memima](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224251/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_memi.htm) but there are definitely others that were suggested in the (now lost) thread.
Is [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224251/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16007.html?1063702612) the thread you were referring to, Patricia?

No... it was more recent than that. I didn't discover this site until March. There's a whole chunk of archive missing and I remember a thread about connected scripts like this maybe 2 months ago. Yves???
hmmm... isn't that the one mm paris did for bj�rk?

Yves, do you remember the same thread I do - there are certainly other fonts (besides Memima) that have that same connected look, but I don't know the names.   
   
Congrats on the bambina by the way.

Similar to the font: ITO (#20)   
by Kinema Moon, Tokyo   
 [http://www.kinemamoon.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224251/http:/www.kinemamoon.com/)
